{"step_by_step_thinking": "At 3 years old, children should have achieved certain developmental milestones. To determine which milestone is considered delayed development, we need to consider the typical development of a 3-year-old child. A. Hopping on one leg is a gross motor skill that is typically achieved around 4-5 years old. B. Drawing a square requires fine motor skills and shape recognition, which are usually developed around 4-5 years old. C. Feeding by spoon is a self-feeding skill that is typically mastered by 2-3 years old. D. Passing a ball to someone is a gross motor skill that can be achieved by most 3-year-olds. Based on this information, the milestone that is most likely to be absent in a 3-year-old child with delayed development is B. Drawing a square.", "answer_choice": "B"}
